name: DeepSpA
title: Detection of radiographic sacroiliitis to classify axial Spondyloarthritis on pelvic radiographs

summary.description: This tool combines a U-Net Segmentation Model with a ResNet-50 for Classification.

outputs.label: Binarized prediction for the presence of r-axSpA
outputs.description: Binarized prediction for the presence of r-axSpA, using the cut-off 0.59

details.name: DeepSpA
details.devteam: AI-Assisted Healthcare (AIAH) Lab at Technical University of Munich and Charité Universitätsmedizin Berlin
details.cite: Felix J. Dorfner, Janis L. Vahldiek, Leonhard Donle, Andrei Zhukov, Lina Xu, Hartmut Häntze, Marcus R. Makowski, Hugo J. W. L. Aerts, Fabian Proft, Valeria Rios Rodriguez, Judith Rademacher, Mikhail Protopopov, Hildrun Haibel, Torsten Diekhoff, Murat Torgutalp, Lisa C. Adams, Denis Poddubnyy and Keno K. Bressem, 'Incorporating Anatomical Awareness for Enhanced Generalizability and Progression Prediction in Deep Learning-Based Radiographic Sacroiliitis Detection', in arXiv, 2024, doi: https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2405.07369

publications.label: Incorporating Anatomical Awareness for Enhanced Generalizability and Progression Prediction in Deep Learning-Based Radiographic Sacroiliitis Detection

use.title: Intended use
use.text: This tool combines a U-Net Segmentation Model with a ResNet-50 for Classification. More information can be found in the corresponding paper [1].

references.label: Incorporating Anatomical Awareness for Enhanced Generalizability and Progression Prediction in Deep Learning-Based Radiographic Sacroiliitis Detection

analyses.title: Evaluation
analyses.text: The model was evaluated on three different external test datasets: GESPIC [1], OptiRef [2] and DAMACT [3,4,5], containing 536, 340, and 163 patients respectively. [6]

training.text: 1483 radiographs from the PROOF study were used for training of the classification and segmentation model. [1,2]
